thread.title: Is burnt toast a health risk?
thread.title_full: Is burnt toast a health risk?

title: Is burnt toast a health risk?
text:
Media playback is unsupported on your device Is burnt toast a health risk? 23 January 2017 Last updated at 00:11 GMT 
Experts say bread, chips and potatoes should be cooked to a golden yellow colour, rather than brown, to reduce our intake of a chemical which could cause cancer. 
Acrylamide is produced when starchy foods are roasted, fried or grilled for too long at high temperatures. Related Topics
